entry.string: Many modules are basically dealing with the equivalent of real-life objects, like news articles, projects, surveys, race tracks or whatever.
entry.translation: 許多模組基本上是處理真實世界物件的對應, 如新聞文章, 專案, 調查, 賽車軌道等各種東西.

entry.string: Those "objects" each have a number of "properties", like an item id, a title, an author, a deadline or a number of VIP places, and their data is generally stored in some dedicated module table.
entry.translation: 這些"物件"有一些"屬性", 如項目id, 標題, 作者, 截止日期或一些 VIP 地點, 且它們的資料通常存再一些想要的模組表格.

entry.string: The whole management of the object instances (creation, modification, display, deletion, ...) is typically hard-coded in the module, and tightly wired to the underlying data structure, which makes it difficult to e.g. add another property to your objects without rewriting half the module code (and templates).
entry.translation: 管理這些物件實體(建立, 修改, 顯示, 刪除, ...)通常寫死在模組裡, 且跟底層的資料結構密合, 難以(舉例)新增屬性到物件而不改寫程式碼(及模版).

entry.string: The Dynamic Data module allows you to dynamically add properties to your module objects, and to integrate them with the rest of the site without much effort - regardless of whether you're the module developer, a third-party solution designer or the website admin.
entry.translation: 動態資料模組讓你能動態地增加屬性到模組物件, 且整合到網站其它部份而不用很大工夫 - 不論你是摸組開發員、協力方案設計者或網站管理員.

entry.string: And no-one says you're limited to existing modules - you could just as easily create whole new objects by defining their properties and telling the Dynamic Data module where their data should be coming from : dedicated module tables, dynamic data fields (auto-generated), some utility module from Xaraya or a user function you'll specify.
entry.translation: 沒有人說你被限制在現有的模組 - 你可以就容易地建立全新物件藉定義它們的屬性並告訴動態資料模組它們的資料應該從哪裡來 : 想要的模組表格、動態資料欄位(自動產生)、一些 Xaraya 的工具模組或你指定的使用者函式.

entry.string: The starting point for all this is of course the admin interface...
entry.translation: 所有這些的起點當然是管理介面...

entry.string: 2. Admin interface of the Dynamic Data module
Explain property types, data sources, validation, input & output representation
entry.translation: 解釋屬性類型、資料結構、確認、輸入及輸出表示

entry.string: 3. Using the <xar:data-* ...> tags in your templates
3.a. User view and admin list (for several items)
entry.translation: 3.a. 使用者檢視及管理清單(多種項目時)

entry.string: 1) if you want to get the dynamic properties and values for your items, and include them somewhere in your own view/list
entry.translation: 1) 如果你想要取得你的項目的動態屬性跟植, 並包含他們於你的檢視/清單

entry.string: Available tags : (replace 'users', '$uidlist' and '$uid' with your own)

this retrieves the dynamic properties defined for the 'users' module, and their value for all items listed in $uidlist. You'll need to build that uid list in your module function and pass it along to the template
this shows the label for dynamic property
this shows the value of dynamic property '$name' for item $uid, i formatted for output
this shows the value of dynamic property '$name' for item $uid, formatted for input
Sample use :
... (somewhere near the beginning of your template) ...
avoid errors when the dynamic data module isn't activated
... (when you're building some table headers, and you want to add labels for the dynamic properties) ...
... (when you're looping over the individual items, and you want to add the dynamic values for item $uid) ...
avoid errors if the value isn't defined for this item (yet)
2) if you want to show a standard list of items, with all the dynamic properties that are defined for that object
Idem for
(Todo : group, join ?)
3.b. User display and admin form (for one item)
1) if you want to get the dynamic properties for this item, and include them manually in your own display
this retrieves the dynamic properties defined for the 'users' module and item $uid. Note that we don't use value="..." here, since we only have one item
... (where you want to add the dynamic labels and values for this item) ...
Idem for input forms, where you'd use <xar:data-input ... /> to show input fields
2) if you simply want to display the dynamic properties for this item (= easier in most cases)
this will use the default layout of user-objectdisplay.xd
this will use layout 'mylayout' of user-objectdisplay.xd
this will use the template user-objectdisplay-myusers.xd
3.c. User output and admin input (for one field of an item)
4. Using hooks
deprecated
5. Using API calls
property types
dynamic objects and object lists
dynamic properties
items : getitems(), getitem(), getfield()
6. Using OO programming
entry.translation: 6. 使用 OO 程式設計

entry.string: 7. Customising Dynamic Data
templates, data sources, functions, validation, ...
8. Integrate utility modules via hooks or dynamic data (or both) ?
9. Import/export utilities
Usage : Export object definitions and/or data - and import them elsewhere...
[+ Easter Egg : util meta -> export to XML -> save to file -> util import -> access your whole database via DD]
